write_up: Slow-building songs have this weird knack of being looped together with all other slow-building songs. I don’t really personally see the connection between songs like ‘He Would Have Laughed’ and ‘Exit Music (For a Film)’, but I guess I see why people would bother to point it out. There’s rare examples of recent bands so uniquely gifted that they are able to sustain a listener’s interest for a meandering six or so minutes. Sometimes it takes a specific time and place where you’re forced to commit your attention to it. For me it was at the back of a city bus in Chile. Lyrically and structurally, ‘He Would Have Laughed’ surprises at almost every turn, despite its energy never really picking up. But who cares about that.
lyric: I lived on a farm, yeah / I never lived on a farm
